front.note:
33RD INTERNATIONAL COSMIC RAY CONFERENCE, RIO DE JANEIRO 2013
THE ASTROPARTICLE PHYSICS CONFERENCE

docTitle.titlePart: The Multiple Muon Charge Ratio in MINOS

byline.docAuthor: C. M. CASTROMONTE 1 , R. A. GOMES 1 , FOR THE

byline.affiliation: 1 Instituto de Física, Universidade Federal de Goiás,

front.div:
Abstract: The MINOS Far Detector is a magnetized planar steel-scintillator detector situated underground at
depth of 2070 mwe. A small fraction of the cosmic ray muons observed in the MINOS FD contain multiple muons.
These events on average are expected to have originated from either higher mass primaries, or higher energy
protons than their single muon counterparts. Using the complete MINOS atmospheric data set we will present the
first measurement of the multiple muon events charge ratio R µ = N µ + /N µ − . Systematic uncertainties on the charge
ratio were minimized by utilizing data collected with both forward and reversed magnetic field running.
front.keyword: Keywords: MINOS, cosmic rays, multiple muons.
